title: Multi-focus - uniform clean segmented bar chart

content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A commercial laundry company that cleans cloth napkins for restaurants in a large city plans to investigate the effectiveness of three different laundry detergents (B, D, and R) in cleaning the two types of stains the cloth napkins arrive with: grease stains and dirt stains. From the company’s large collection of stained cloth napkins, a random sample of <math alttext="300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> cloth napkins known to have only grease stains was selected. Each napkin was randomly assigned to one of the three detergents. The table shows the number of grease-stained cloth napkins successfully cleaned and not successfully cleaned for each detergent. GREASE STAINS Detergent B Detergent D Detergent R Total Successfully cleaned <math alttext="71" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>71</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="49" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="71" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>71</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="191" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>191</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Not successfully cleaned <math alttext="33" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>33</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="37" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="39" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="109" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>109</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Total <math alttext="104" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>104</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="86" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>86</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="110" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>110</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (a) Compare the relative frequencies of grease-stained napkins successfully cleaned for each detergent to determine which is highest.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A commercial laundry company that cleans cloth napkins for restaurants in a large city plans to investigate the effectiveness of three different laundry detergents (B, D, and R) in cleaning the two types of stains the cloth napkins arrive with: grease stains and dirt stains. From the company’s large collection of stained cloth napkins, a random sample of <math alttext="300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> cloth napkins known to have only grease stains was selected. Each napkin was randomly assigned to one of the three detergents. The table shows the number of grease-stained cloth napkins successfully cleaned and not successfully cleaned for each detergent. GREASE STAINS Detergent B Detergent D Detergent R Total Successfully cleaned <math alttext="71" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>71</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="49" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="71" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>71</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="191" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>191</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Not successfully cleaned <math alttext="33" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>33</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="37" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="39" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="109" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>109</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Total <math alttext="104" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>104</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="86" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>86</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="110" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>110</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (a) Compare the relative frequencies of grease-stained napkins successfully cleaned for each detergent to determine which is highest.

From the company’s large collection of stained cloth napkins, a second random sample of <math alttext="150" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> cloth napkins known to have only dirt stains was selected. Each napkin was randomly assigned to one of the three detergents. The segmented bar graph shows the distribution of the number of dirt-stained cloth napkins successfully cleaned and not successfully cleaned for each detergent. (b) Write a few sentences describing what the graph reveals about the association between detergent and cleaning success among the <math alttext="150" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dirt-stained cloth napkins.

(c) For each detergent, give a statistical reason why the laundry company might choose to use the detergent to clean all cloth napkins for restaurants in the city. Do not perform an inferential procedure.

The laundry company plans to use the sample data to investigate whether there is convincing statistical evidence, at <math alttext="alpha equals 0.03" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.03</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, that the proportion of grease-stained napkins that would be successfully cleaned using Detergent R is less than the proportion of dirt-stained napkins that would be successfully cleaned using Detergent R.(d) Name the appropriate test and state, in words, the hypotheses.
(e) State the conditions for the appropriate test, and explain why the conditions are met.

(f) The test statistic for the appropriate test is <math alttext="negative 1.740" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.740</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (grease minus dirt). Based on the result of the hypothesis test, what conclusion should the company make? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.3: Representing a Categorical Variable with Tables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
